==========
 Overview
==========

What is Babel ?
---------------------

Babel is an open source Python module which provides a |Python|_ ....

How is Babel licensed ?
-----------------------------

Babel is licensed under the `GPLv3 <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/quick-guide-gplv3.en.html>`_.

Going further with Babel
------------------------------

The best way to know what you can do with Babel, and to learn it, is to look at the examples:

 * :ref:`Babel Reference Manual <reference-manual-page>`
 * :ref:`Bibliography <bibliography-page>`

Which platforms are supported by Babel ?
----------------------------------------------

Babel runs on Linux, Windows 64-bit and Mac OS X.

How to install Babel ?
----------------------------

The procedure to install Babel is described in the :ref:`Installation Manual <installation-page>`.

Which version of Python is required ?
-------------------------------------

Babel requires Python 3 and the version 3.5 is recommended so as to benefit from the new *@* syntax
for units.
